Dear Amanda Waidelich:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not
result in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth’s background
or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or about 01/02/2023, Staff 1 made verbal threats to both Youth
A and Youth B. Staff 1 threatened that she would "smack a punk
ass kid" however she did not. Youth B and Staff 1 were having a
conversation about Youth B’s behaviors she displayed when
Youth B said, she wants to hit staff when she gets made, Staff 1
replied, "I want to hit y'all when I'm upset but I don't".
Investigation Complainant/Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 1/3/2024.
She reported being present when Staff 1 told Youth B that Staff 1
gets mad with different youth at times and stated, “I want to smack
the hell out of all of you”. This occurred after Youth B shared “I
can’t control putting my hands on staff at times”.
Complainant/Staff 5 also reported this conversation occurred after
Staff 1 told Youth B, that Youth B didn’t learn her lesson after
putting her hands on staff the last time. Staff 1 continued to tell
Youth B, that Youth B is not learning the lesson even though
Youth B was ignoring Staff 1 until Youth B walked away.
Complainant/Staff 5 reported later in the day, while in the kitchen
with Staff 1, Staff 3 came into the kitchen and confronted Staff 1
saying Staff 3 heard what Staff 1 said to Youth B. Staff 1
responded by saying Staff 3 didn’t hear anything. Staff 3 told Staff
1 she is not allowed to speak to the youth like she did with Youth
B.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on 1/3/2024. She
reported being made aware of the allegations and having Staff 1
removed from working until the investigation was completed. She
also reported this behavior is out of the norm for Staff 1. Staff 1
was addressed about her tone of voice and words used when
speaking to different youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/4/2024.
Staff 1 reported that during the incident with Youth B, Staff 1 said
that she “sometimes gets really upset with my kids and wants to
2

slap my kids”. Staff 1 reported referring to her biological children
rather than youth in the program. In regard to the incident with
Youth A in the cafeteria, Staff 1 reported being asked to assist
with Youth A who was struggling in the cafeteria, so she went and
swapped with Supervisor. Staff 4 was attempting to deescalate
Youth A while Youth A was spitting and swinging at Staff 4 before
beginning to bang his head against the wall. Staff 1 told Staff 4 to
step back and Staff 1 began an intervention. Staff 1 wanted to get
Youth A ready to meet with his caseworker, so Staff 1 raised her
voice in an effort to yell over Youth A who was screaming. Staff 1
reported using this technique to get Youth A to listen to her. Staff
1 also reported being told in the past by Administrator 3 to not
raise her voice but just let the youth sit and scream. The next
encounter with Youth A and Staff 1 occurred when Staff 1 was told
(did not identify who) she was needed in the cafeteria again
because Youth A was biting himself. Staff 1 went to the cafeteria
with Staff 6 and after Youth A began to calm down and Staff 1 was
leaving the cafeteria, Youth A charged Staff 4. Youth A was
swinging and striking Staff 4 so Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s wrist in
a release hold when Youth A had grabbed Staff 4’s shirt putting
his hands at his side. Youth A continue to charge Staff 4 and Staff
1 reported she said to Youth A, “you don’t think I will hit you. It’s a
cold day in hell if you think I will let you hit a staff or allow a punk
child to hit me and abuse another staff who is half your size”.
Staff 1 also reported Staff 3 spoke to her about Staff 1 using a
loud voice. Staff 1 told Staff 3 that Youth A was acting out, so Staff
1 started yelling because both Youth A and Staff 4 were yelling.
Staff 1 was unable to recall what else was said between Staff 1
and Staff 3. Staff 1 denied any disciplinary action in her personnel
file.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/4/2024.
She reported beginning work at the facility on 12/4/23 and only
being on the floor with youth by herself for the past week. She
reported being present during the incident between Staff 1 and
Youth B. Staff 2 was the primary staff attending to Youth B when
Staff 1 (also in the area) brought up Youth B’s behaviors from the
previous day. Staff 1 suggested Youth B should not be going to
field day (scheduled for the next day) because of Youth B’s
behaviors the previous day. Youth B was reported to have
responded by saying, Youth B will get worked up sometimes and
want to hit staff. Staff 1 responded saying “I get mad at you kids
and want to slap you kids”. Staff 2 reported Youth B ignored Staff
1 and continued to work on a puzzle. Staff 2 told Youth B he was
displaying good behaviors today. Staff 2 also reported redirecting
Youth B so as not to escalate Staff 1. Staff 2’s fear was saying
3

something about Youth B ignoring Staff 1 would have escalated
Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1’s tone when speaking to Youth B
was “quick, snarky and negative”, thus just being “not a good
tone”. Staff 2 reported not saying anything to a supervisor
because none were present at the time but later in the shift, Staff
2 discussed the incident with Staff 4 and Complainant/Staff 5 and
now understands that in the future Staff 2 will seek out a
supervisor immediately.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/4/2024.
Staff 3 reported being present for a portion of the incident between
Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 3 was in the kitchen when she
overheard muffled voices through the rolling door between the
kitchen and cafeteria. She believed one voice was that of a youth
and the other of a staff. Both voices grew louder, and Staff 3 was
able to make out the staff telling the youth not to hit staff. Staff 3
came out of the kitchen and into the cafeteria and observed Youth
A. Staff 3 noticed Youth A was beginning to put hands on Staff 4.
Staff 1 was present and neither staff asked for assistance, so Staff
3 returned to the kitchen. Later Staff 1 came into the kitchen
where Staff 3 was still working, and Staff 3 reported telling Staff 1
that Staff 1 was loud in her interaction with Youth A. Staff 3 was
unable to recall all that was said but did recall telling Staff 1, that
Staff 1’s actions were inappropriate. Staff 3 also reported writing
up a description of the incident for the supervisor.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
1/4/2024. She reported not being present during either incident
but was informed about the incidents that evening. Administrator 2
was informed of the incidents by Supervisor 1 who informed
Administrator 2, that Supervisor 1 was informed of the incidents by
Staff 2, Staff 4, and Complainant/Staff 5. Administrator 2 informed
Administrator 3 of the incidents and was told by Administrator 3 to
have the staff write up reports of the incidents and report the
incidents to MDHHS. Administrator 2 also spoke with Staff 3 about
Staff 3 confronting Staff 1 in the kitchen and Staff 3 reported not
remembering what she had said but it was something about Staff
1 being inappropriate with the youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
1/4/2024. She reported being present in the cafeteria when Staff 4
and Youth A where in the cafeteria. Supervisor swapped out with
Staff 1, when Staff 1 entered the cafeteria. Supervisor did not
witness anything more about the incident in the cafeteria and was
not present at the incident with Youth B. Supervisor also reported
Complainant/Staff 5 and Staff 2 came to her later in the shift with
4

concerns of Staff 1’s treatment of Youth A and Youth B during the
day. Supervisor informed Administrator 2 of the allegations and
sought the correct path for reporting the information. Supervisor
reported being told Staff 1 made comments that made Staff 2 and
Complainant/Staff 5 very uncomfortable.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/4/2024.
She reported being present during both incidents. In the situation
with Youth B, Staff 4 reported Staff 1 asked Youth B why Youth B
put her hands on staff and Youth B reported getting mad
sometimes and wanting to put hands-on others. Staff 1 responded
with the statement, “when I get mad, I want to smack all of you
kids”. Staff 4 was unsure if Staff 1 was referring to her own
children or youth in the program but believes Staff 1 was referring
to youth in the program. Staff 1 said “I will contain your ass if you
touch staff again”. During the second incident as Youth A was
finishing his dinner, Staff 1 walked into the cafeteria and got into
Youth A’s face. Staff 1 said “if I hear that you touched a female
again, I will slap a punk ass kid”. Youth A responded with “you will
lose your job over slapping a punk ass kid”. Staff 4 was unaware if
any others heard this conversation. Staff 4 reported going to
Supervisor with Complainant/Staff 5 to report the incidents and
being told by Administrator 3 to report the incidents to MDHHS.
Staff 4 reported Staff 1 tends to intimidate the youth and often just
speaks her mind.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
1/4/2024. Youth A reported not always feeling safe at the facility
because “there is a youth here who wants to bite me”. However,
Youth A also reported staff are attentive and keep an eye on this
other youth. Youth A reported no issues with staff and didn’t recall
the incident that was reported with Staff 1. Youth A reported
receiving help while in the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
1/4/2024. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility and being
treated well by the staff. Youth B also reported having no issues
with any staff and that staff do take care of her.
Administrator 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
1/4/2024. He reported being told by Administrator 2 of the incident
and spoke with Supervisor on the phone to gather more details.
After gathering information, Administrator 3 informed Administrator
2 that the staff with information needed to report the incidents to
MDHHS. He reported this all took place on the same day of the
incidents. He also reported Staff 1 has one verbal coaching
5

(9/28/22) for confronting a youth about an inappropriate
conversation they had. Staff 1 has a history of bring “drama” into
the facility and there have been discussions about poor
boundaries with Staff 1. Administrator 3 reported Staff 1 presents
with integrity issues since she is not always truthful about issues
and is “rough around the edges”.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident/Accident Report dated 1/2/24 @ 5:00 pm and written
by Staff 4. In this document both incidents between Youth A and
Staff 1 are described by Staff 4. Staff 4’s description of the
incidents matches what she wrote in her written statement (below)
and what she disclosed in her verbal interview with the exception
of the following information. The second incident between Staff 1
and Youth A also occurred in the cafeteria. Youth A was in the
cafeteria with Staff 4 when Staff 1 entered and approached Youth
A getting into Youth A’s face. Staff 1 left the area and Staff 4
focused on helping Youth A self-regulate Youth A’s emotions.
Incident/Accident Report dated 1/2/24 @ 3:20 pm and written
by Staff 4. This document describes the incident between Staff 1
and Youth B which took place earlier the same day as the
incidents between Staff 1 and Youth A. The description matches
the verbal interview and written report by Staff 4 with the
exception of the following details. Youth B was sharing how
excited Youth B was to be going on the field trip tomorrow when
Staff 1 began to question Youth B about behaviors displayed the
day before. The more Youth B ignored Staff 1 the louder Staff 1
spoke to Youth B. This is when Staff 1 responded with “sometimes
when I get mad, I want to smack all you kids, but you see me do
that”. Staff 1 then left the area.
Staff 3 written report of the incidents dated 1/4/2024. This
written document outlines the information Staff 3 presented during
her interview. She did not see any of the interactions between
Youth A and Staff 1 but did hear Staff 1 raise her voice towards
Youth A. Staff 3 also documented speaking to Staff 1 about
raising her voice but didn’t recall a response from Staff 1.
Complainant/Staff 5 written report of the incidents dated
1/4/2023. This written document outlines the information
Complainant/Staff 5 presented during her interview. There is no
new information from this document, and it mirrors what she
reported.
6

Staff 4 written report of the incidents dated 1/4/2024. This
written document outlines the information Staff 4 presented during
her interview. The incident with Youth B is documented the same
as her interview. The incident with Youth A has more information
documented. Staff 4 wrote that Staff 1 responded to Youth A
telling Staff 1 she will lose her job if she hits him by stating, “I don’t
care, I will lose a job over a punk ass kid laying hands on a
female, I am not scared of you, do you understand me”.
Staff 2 written report of the incidents dated 1/4/2024. This
written document outlines the information Staff 2 presented during
her interview. This information is a mirror of what she said during
the interview and there is nothing new documented.
Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment Behavior
Management dated 6/16/2023. This document outlines staff’s
intervention with youth and it is stated staff are to use “positive
intervention strategies to assist the youth to develop improved
problem solving, self-management, and social skills”. If a youth
refuses to follow expected behaviors/house rules, staff are to
encourage participation. All youth have individual calming plans
and/or behavior treatment plans based on specific needs. Staff
are expected to follow both individual plans to encourage safety
and behavioral treatment efforts.
Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment Discipline
dated 9/17/2018. This document outlines what is prohibited by
staff in regard to discipline. The third list of items involve verbal
abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
Individual Safety & Calming Plan for Youth A signed on
11/14/2023. This document outlines the triggers for Youth A which
include placing demands on Youth A. Counterproductive
strategies include staff using a strong tone, consequence-based
responses/reactions, and negatively reacting to Youth A’s
behavior. Pro-active safety strategies include staff not over-attend
to Youth A’s negative behaviors and provide redirection in an
easy-to-understand manner. Crisis intervention strategies include
taking Youth A to the cafeteria and offer space and other suitable
coping options. Staff are to remain calm and speak calmly.
Emergency safety/last resort is outlined and if physical
management is initiated staff are to allow Youth A to calm down,
inform Youth A of what is expected of Youth A before releasing.
Individual Safety & Calming Plan for Youth B signed on
11/27/2023. This document outlines the triggers,
7

counterproductive strategies not to use and pro-active strategies
staff are to use in helping Youth B calm down. Making demands
on Youth B is considered a trigger and not having set expectations
is considered counterproductive. A pro-active strategy for staff is
to keep the conversation simple, clear, and simple explanations
and not argue back when Youth B does not comply with
expectations. Staff are to inform Youth B; they are willing to speak
to Youth B when Youth B is ready to talk. Staff are also to remain
calm and speak calmly.
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 was
hired at the facility on 6/9/2022. Staff 1 completed orientation on
6/14/22 and 6/15/22 and is current on all required trainings and
completed TLC/Compassion Fatigue training on 10/26/2023. Staff
1 also completed Customer Service training on 4/4/23 and
12/18/23. Documentation outlines, Staff 1 received verbal
coaching on 9/2/23 for confronting a youth about an inappropriate
conversation. Documentation indicates Staff 1 confront the youth
in their bedroom after the issue had been resolved with the youth.
It was determined that Staff 1 was not providing a safe and
positive environment for the youth. Additionally, Staff 1 was
accused of having discrepancies in the statement she provided
about the incident.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation there is
evidence that supports Staff 1 did not follow the policy/procedure
that required positive interventions with Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 1 engaged in verbal abuse with Youth A and Youth B.
Technical Assistance:
Discussed with the facility the need to outline staff techniques
within the residential treatment plan and not just the Individual
Safety & Calming Plan. This will allow the referring worker to
understand staff’s interventions with the youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000422SI dated 5/2023, CAP approved 5/10/2023
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
8

Allegation Staff 1 pushed Youth A against a metal rolling door and pulled him
by his wrists during an escort.
Investigation Complainant/Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 1/8/2024.
She reported not being present when the escort of Youth A by
Staff 1 and Staff 6 took place. She was working with other youth in
a different area at the time.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/4/2024.
Staff 1 denied pinning Youth A against the wall or rolldown
window. Staff 1 was interviewed again via phone on 1/8/2024.
Staff 1 reported being part of the escort of Youth A into the
cafeteria but denied pulling Youth A up to do so. She also
reported Youth A was sitting on the couch and both Staff 1 and
Staff 6 escorted Youth A. The only dragging that took place was
when Youth A dropped his weight before beginning to walk with
the escort again.
Staff 2 was interviewed again via phone on 1/8/2024. She
reported not witnessing the escort of Youth A by Staff 1 and Staff
6.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/4/2024.
In regard to the two incidents with Youth A, she gave the following
report on the first incident with Youth A. Youth A was in the
cafeteria with Staff 4 when he became physical with Staff 4. Staff
1 entered the room and got between Staff 4 and Youth A. Staff 1
pushed Youth A against the rolling door and held him against it.
Staff 1 is reported to have said “I will contain your ass if you touch
staff again”. Staff 4 also reported Youth A was in the process of
being deescalated when Staff 1 came between them and pushed
Youth A. Staff 4 prompted Staff 1 to take a break, but Staff 1 didn’t
respond. Staff 4 was interviewed again via phone on 1/8/2024.
She reported being present for the escort of Youth A by Staff 1
and Staff 6, however, she also reported not observing the
beginning of the escort because she was holding open the
cafeteria door and this blocked her view. She reported not
observing Youth A drop his weight but listening to the escort, she
believed Youth A did drop his weight and when they reached the
cafeteria door, Youth A was walking. Administrator 2 came into
the cafeteria after Staff 1 let go of pushing Youth A against the
metal rolling door and didn’t witness the incident. Staff 4 reported
a belief that Staff 2 may have witnessed the beginning of the
escort but was unsure.
Staff 6 was interviewed via phone on 1/8/2024. He reported
being present when Youth A was escorted back to the cafeteria
9

after refusing to return to the cafeteria. Staff 6 reported being the
staff who asked Youth A to return to the cafeteria and when Youth
A refused, Staff 6 informed Youth A that Youth A would be
escorted. “Staff 1 grabbed Youth A by the wrists and began to
drag him before Youth A stood up” with Staff 1 and Staff 6 each
holding an arm. Staff 6 reported “Staff 1 only drug Youth A a few
inches before standing up”. The other staff present was either
Complainant/Staff 5 or Staff 4 (unable to recall which staff) who
held the door open for them to enter the cafeteria. Staff 6 reported
no staff spoke to Youth A during the escort and Staff 6 spoke to
Youth A once in the cafeteria. Staff 6 reported Youth A began to
calm down and was pacing in the cafeteria before Staff 6 left. Staff
6 left when Administrator 2 came into the room. Staff 6 denied
observing Staff 1 push Youth A against the kitchen rolling door.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident/Accident Report dated 1/2/24 @ 5:00 pm and written
by Staff 4. In this document both incidents between Youth A and
Staff 1 are described by Staff 4. Staff 4’s description of the
incidents matches what she wrote in her written statement and
what she disclosed in her interview with the exception of the
following information. Youth A was escorted to the cafeteria by
Staff 1 and Staff 6 after becoming dysregulated. Once in the
cafeteria, Youth A became aggressive toward Staff 4 and Staff 4
was able to successfully use blocking techniques before Youth A
began to self-regulate. Staff 4 reported Youth A was in the
process of becoming self-regulated when Staff 1 pushed Youth A
up against the cafeteria gate, holding Youth A there while
screaming at Youth A. Staff 4 also reported prompting Staff 1 to
stop but Staff 1 ignored Staff 4 and continued to scream at Youth
A. Staff 4 again prompted Staff 1 to take a break but Staff 1
refused and didn’t stop until Administrator 2 came into the room
and told both Staff 1 and Staff 4 to leave.
Handle With Care Module 7 – The Primary Restraint
Technique PRT and Takedown without a date. This document
outlines staff’s position during a youth escort. Staff are to use their
free hand to secure the youth’s arm at the wrist and use the other
hand to hook the youth’s right arm. This involves two staff
escorting the youth. There is no mention of pulling on the youth’s
arms.
Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment – Resident
Restraint, Emergency Restraint dated 3/16/23. This document
outlines that staff must use the least restrictive intervention
necessary and must follow an individualized set of graduated
10

interventions that avoids the use of restraints. It also outlines that
staff must perform the action in a manner that is safe, appropriate,
and proportionate to the severity of the youth’s behavior.
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 was
hired at the facility on 6/9/22. Staff 1 completed orientation on
6/14/22 and 6/15/22 and is current on all required trainings and
completed TLC/Compassion Fatigue training on 10/26/23. Staff 1
also completed Customer Service training on 4/4/23 and 12/18/23.
Documentation outlines, Staff 1 received verbal coaching on
9/2/23 for confronting a youth about an inappropriate
conversation. Documentation indicates Staff 1 confront the youth
in their bedroom after the issue had been resolved with the youth.
It was determined that Staff 1 was not providing a safe and
positive environment for the youth. Additionally, Staff 1 was
accused of having discrepancies in the statement she provided
about the incident.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation there is
evidence that supports Staff 1 did not follow policy and/or rules
when Staff 1 engaged in pulling Youth A during a reported escort
of Youth A and pushing Youth A against the metal roll door in the
cafeteria. Staff 1 also failed to follow the specific safety plan
requirements during her interactions with Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
